artist: Painter: Maruyama Ōzui; Calligrapher: Ōta Nanpo
creditline: The Christina N. and Swan J. Turnblad Memorial Fund
description: The colophons translate as: 1 (first three lines): “Born in Suruga Province; its land of origin the village of Ōmi. ’Tis the finest mountain in all the world; no other can begin to compare.” 2 (final four lines): “Even foreigners must come all the way here if they want to see the greatest mountain in the world!”
inscription:
生国駿河者本国近江郷　三国一山外出廓出店＊＊ {Shōkoku Suruga wa, hongoku Ōmi [no] sato, sangoku-ichi [no] yama, dekuruwa demise} (Born in Suruga Province; its land of origin the village of Ōmi. ’Tis the finest mountain in all the world; no other can begin to compare.)
[唐人もここまで御＊＊あまの原三国一の山が見たくば] {Tōjin mo koko made [gozare]. Ama no hara sangoku-ichi no yama ga mitakuba.} (Even foreigners must come all the way here if they want to see the greatest mountain in the world!)
markings: LRC red artist\'s seal: [應瑞] {Ōzui}; URC at beginning of calligraphy, red seal: XX; LLC at the end of calligraphy, red seals: [南][畝] {Nan/po}
signed: [應瑞画] {Ōzui ga}; Calligraphy signed: [蜀山人] {Shokusanjin}
title: Mount Fuji
